stanza.line: When forty winters shall besiege thy browbrow
And dig deep trenches in thy beauty fieldfield
Thy youth proud livery so gazed on nownow
Will be a tattered weed of small worth heldheld
Then being asked where all thy beauty lieslies
Where all the treasure of thy lusty daysdays
To say within thine own deep sunken eyeseyes
Were an all-eating shame and thriftless praisepraise
How much more praise deserved thy beauty useuse
If thou couldst answer This fair child of minemine
Shall sum my count and make my old excuseexcuse
Proving his beauty by succession thinethine
This were to be new made when thou art oldold
And see thy blood warm when thou feel it coldcold
